page.title: 14A CARAVAN IN FLAKEBRIDGE
page.content: We have lived in a caravan for the past 4 years.It has been rewarding in many ways.My husband's work in forestry has taken us to lots of beautiful places,mostly in the north of England.For the past 18 months we have been at Flakebridge.This is a large mixed woodland teeming with wildlife.Living in a caravan & travelling broadens one's outlook on life.It makes one appreciate small luxuries such as water & electricity neither of which we have.We meet people from different walks of life,from the roadside gypsy to landowners,finding good & bad in all societies.It has been an experience well worth having even though it is a hard life.I enjoy each season as it comes & goes,seeing nature at its best.
